channel.title: java on Cupper
channel.description: Recent content in java on Cupper

item.title: Java Access Specifiers
item.description: So many times there is confusion about java and its access specifers. Here’s what they mean once and for all. Public: Available to all wherever you may be. Private: Available only to me. Protected: Available to my derived types. Friend: Available to all who belong to my group (package) i.e. are my friends. Naturally, if I make a class private it can’t be accessed by anyone except the class itself! Now trying make a class protected.
